alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; East Turnagain Arm; Matanuska Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 5:57PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW LIKELY TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... An area of low pressure will bring strong winds and widespread precipitation to much of Southcentral Alaska from late Tuesday through late Wednesday. Strong winds are expected from the Matanuska Valley southward through the Cook Inlet. Winds gusting to 30 mph will result in reduced visibility to one half mile at times. Stronger wind gusts out of the Matanuska Valley may reduce visibility even further in locations such as Palmer and Wasilla. Snow is expected to begin across the Kenai Peninsula and Anchorage Tuesday and then the Mat-Su Valley early Wednesday morning. A couple inches of snowfall are expected for much of the area before transitioning to rain on Wednesday as temperatures warm above freezing. Rain on snow may reduce blowing snow potential.

area.areaDesc: Anchorage; East Turnagain Arm; Matanuska Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula
